triples.name: Deep reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper is centered on deep RL approaches for training robots in real-world environments, discussing case studies and challenges specific to this methodology.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Reinforcement learning is the fundamental paradigm discussed in the paper as the basis for teaching robots to acquire complex behaviors through interaction with their environment.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence in video games
triples.relevance: The paper discusses how much deep RL research has focused on video games, which differs from real-world robotic applications discussed in the review.

triples.name: Robot learning
triples.relevance: Robot learning is the central domain of this review, covering how physical robots acquire complex skills through deep reinforcement learning in real-world settings.

triples.name: Embodied agent
triples.relevance: The paper emphasizes learning as embodied agents in the real world, which provides unique challenges and advantages compared to simulated domains.

triples.name: Cognitive robotics
triples.relevance: Cognitive robotics encompasses the intersection of learning perception and movement in real environments that the paper focuses on.
